p: Betel leaves had been known to contain many active compounds, mainly hydrochavicol, cavibetol acetate and eugenol ( Begam et al., 2018). Based on previous study, it had been demonstrated that red betel leaves extract, along with its active constituents: eugenol and hydroxychavicol, can scavenging H 2O 2 and DPPH also reducing FRAP and ABTS radicals that indicated their antioxidant activity ( Lister et al., 2019a). Eugenol also had been reported could decrease the ALT and AST activities and LDH level in liver injury model that induced by APAP ( Lister et al., 2019b).
